title: [FEATURE] Expose SkImageFilters::RuntimeShader()

comments.author: cyraid
comments.body:
I'm wanting to do shaders too, but it seems there's a large lack of support. @mattleibow Think we could have some better uniform setting support too? :) (instead of just WriteTo with a byte span). Just passing a simple color to an effect shader seems to be a lot of boiler plate! Let alone passing floats, etc.

Edit Edit: By better support I mean, uniform.Set(float), uniform.Set(float[]), uniform.Set(SKColorF), etc. For those coming in not knowing there's implicit operator overrides.

Edit: I found out I can set the SKRuntimeEffectUniform and it'll accept Span<float>, so anyone coming here wondering an easy way to do it?

```csharp
ColorF color = new SKColorF(1, 0, 0, 1); // 100% Red, with 100% alpha
Span<float> colorSpan = stackalloc float[4] { color.Red, color.Green, color.Blue, color.Alpha };
SKRuntimeEffectUniform colorUniform = colorSpan;
```
or without stackalloc:
```csharp
ColorF color = new SKColorF(1, 0, 0, 1); // 100% Red, with 100% alpha
Span<float> colorFloats = new float[4] { color.Red, color.Green, color.Blue, color.Alpha };
SKRuntimeEffectUniform colorUniform = colorFloats;
```
